content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I used the "google" command to search for the best route to take on the Brno Reservoir trail hiking and received several links to websites. Then, I used the "browse_website" command to gather more information from greatruns.com. The website provided information on 8 km of the most suitable running in the reservoir area, with rolling hills and a good starting point at U Sirky beach. It also gave options for running near the 13th-century Veveří Castle, including quiet, low trafficked roads and trails in the Junák hiking area. The website did not directly answer the question of what the best route to take on the Brno Reservoir trail is. Recently, I used the "google" command again to search for the best route to take on the Brno Reservoir trail hiking and received several links to websites. The command returned links to greatruns.com, alltrails.com, hikingisgood.com, outdooractive.com, and more.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "browse_website", "args": {"url": "https://hikingisgood.com/around-the-brno-reservoir/", "question": "What is the best route to take on the Brno Reservoir trail?"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: a description of a classic local hike around the Brno Reservoir in Czechia. The author recommends starting in Žebětín and following the green marked route through the forest to Podkomorské lesy. From there, the hike continues to Veveří Castle and then follows the red marked route along the reservoir's eastern side, offering nice views. The hike takes about four hours and ends at the port, where a tram can be taken back to the city center. Swimming in the reservoir is not recommended due to algae. No specific information is given about the best route to take on the trail.\n\nLinks: ['\\n\\n\\nHiking Is Good\\nBorn from the love of hiking, writing, photography and life\\n\\n\\n (https://hikingisgood.com/)', 'MENU (https://hikingisgood.com/around-the-brno-reservoir/)', 'Blog (https://hikingisgood.com/category/blog/)', 'Reports\\n► (https://hikingisgood.com/around-the-brno-reservoir/)', 'Reports (https://hikingisgood.com/category/hike-reports/)']", type='action_result')]
"""
